title: How to Draw a Shaded Sphere

steps.headline: Draw a hollow circle with a light line.
steps.description: You can use a pair of compasses or trace a round object or circular template to get a clean circle.

steps.headline: Choose a light source for this sphere.
steps.description: The light source in this example is on the upper left, somewhat in front of the page (or behind the viewer).

steps.headline: Begin shading.
steps.description: Start opposite the light source and move inwards. The darkest area will be furthest from the light source. Create circles or partial circles of equal value (darkness).

steps.headline: As you move towards the light source, fill the circle with less and less pressure, heavier on the dark area, lighter on the light area.
steps.description: You can leave a round spot nearest the light source the color of the white page.

steps.headline: Use your finger or a tortillon to blend the shading and add a shadow.
steps.description: Notice how the circle now appears spherical, with depth.
